etymology.description: 浴 (bathe) + 巾 (cloth/towel) = towel used for bathing.
etymology.interpretation: Pairs the act of bathing with a piece of cloth to specify its function: a towel for use during or after bathing. A purpose-driven verb–noun compound.

parts.english: bathe; to take a bath; to wash; to immerse

examples.chinese: 洗完澡(洗完澡)，我用浴巾擦干身体(我用浴巾擦乾身體)。
examples.pinyin: Xǐ wán zǎo, wǒ yòng yùjīn cā gān shēntǐ.
examples.english: After showering, I dry my body with a bath towel.

examples.chinese: 浴室里有备用的浴巾(浴室裡有備用的浴巾)。
examples.pinyin: Yùshì lǐ yǒu bèiyòng de yùjīn.
examples.english: There are spare bath towels in the bathroom.

examples.chinese: 请把干净的浴巾递给我(請把乾淨的浴巾遞給我)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng bǎ gānjìng de yùjīn dì gěi wǒ.
examples.english: Please hand me a clean bath towel.
